title: Bring Your Illustrations to Life: 2D Animation with AE
author: MiuA

items.title: 01. Orientation
items.description: Introducing your instructor. What you will learn (important notes, the techniques, class levels). Preparation advice (mandatory and optional software and device). Quick preview for the workflow. Goals.

sections.title: Section 02: First Things First: Let's Start Drawing!

items.title: 02. Visualize Your Idea
items.description: Making thumbnail based on your rough idea. Break down the movement.

items.title: 03. Assets Drawing: Introduction
items.description: Comparison of asset separation techniques. Guide to preparing efficient sketch. Deciding which part to separate.

items.title: 04. Assets Drawing (Part 1)
items.description: Drawing lineart based on the tidy sketch (character's body and accessories). Prepare base color for each lineart (character's body and accessories).

items.title: 05. Assets Drawing (Part 2)
items.description: Tips on how to make the assets look seamless and connected. Coloring each asset (character's body and accessories).

items.title: 06. Assets Drawing (Part 3)
items.description: Drawing lineart based on the tidy sketch (hand and the rest of accessories). Preparing base color for each lineart (hand and the rest of accessories). Coloring each asset (hand and the rest of accessories). Final color retouch.

items.title: 07. Reviewing the Assets
items.description: Reviewing what we have illustrated. Homework: Try developing your own style.

sections.title: Section 03: Time to Get Ready: Prep Everything We'll Need

items.title: 08. The Importance of Assets Preparation
items.description: Moving the illustration file to your laptop. Learn 8 things to do in assets preparation and the reason. Introduction to After Effect (importing files, layout panel, composition). Explain how assets preparation affect our animation files.

items.title: 09. Organizing Your Assets
items.description: Apply "8 things to do in assets preparation" to our previously made character files.

sections.title: Section 04: For Beginners: Learn the Basics, It's the Foundation!

items.title: 10. Basic After Effect Explanation (Part 1)
items.description: Deciding duration and FPS. What is transform and keyframe. Adjusting keyframe speed (graph editor) and path lane (keyframe interpolation). Hiding object (visibility and shy toggle). Blending modes. Activating 3D layers. Masking (pen tool, preserving underlying opacity, track matte). What is parenting. Crop and collapsing composition. How renaming and changing footage location on your PC/laptop impact the AE files.

items.title: 11. Basic After Effect Explanation (Part 2)
items.description: How to find and apply effect & preset to our layer. 2 out of 12 principals of animation (squash and stretch, overlapping and followthrough). 6 Distortion tools (puppet, CC bend it, mesh warp, liquify, turbulent displace, corner pin). Deciding when to use the deformer type in the most efficient way. New task! Practicing on your own.

items.title: 12. 3D Illusion Using 2D Images & Parallax Animation
items.description: 5 important things to make a fake 3D effect (parallax, silhouette, topology, perspective, lighting and shading). Adding dimension to a character (making 3/4 view, leaning forward, and backward position).

items.title: 13. Animation Part 1: Preparation
items.description: Open AE files. Set FPS and duration. Importing PSD files. Edit composition bound box. Uncheck every composition collapse toggle. Adjusting anchor point. Activating track matter, 3D layer, and collapse composition. Set layer parenting. Arrange assets rotation, position, and shape to match the sketch guide.

sections.title: Section 05: Let's Level Up: Dive into Complex Animation!

items.title: 14. Animation Part 2: Making Main Keypose
items.description: Start deforming the assets in detail. Giving dimension to head and body parts. Add parallax movement and depth to the hand and finger. Giving dimension on accessories (glasses and wings). What is Null?

items.title: 15. Animation Part 3: Adding More Keypose and Arrange the Timing
items.description: How to make new keyposes from our 2 previously-made keyposes. Adding more keypose, before and after the main keypose to enhance the results. Arrange the keypose timing and adjust other composition to match it. Add color reflection to the glasses.

items.title: 16. Animation Part 4: Eyes and Mouth
items.description: Animate eyes blink. Animate mouth open and closing.

items.title: 17. Animation Part 5: Adding Overlapping and Followthrough Effect
items.description: Adding overlapping and followthrough effect on body, hand, finger, hair, chin, earrings, and wings. Make dangling motion to earrings. When to use easy-ease and auto-bezier in graph editor.

items.title: 18. Animation Part 6: Giving Reflection and Shine Effect
items.description: Adding overlapping and followthrough effect on the halo. Adding color shift effect on halo. Using turbulent noise to add texture. Adding glittery texture to object. Making flickering light effect. Making the keyframe to looping.

items.title: 19. Animation Part 7: Final Touch
items.description: Make a chain rotation pattern. Add focus and bluring. Make background parallax movement. Time remapping.

items.title: 20. Rendering
items.description: Brief explanation of some video files. Step by step rendering. New task! Practicing on your own.

sections.title: Section 06: Wrapping It Up: Closure and Bonus

items.title: 21. What to Do in the Animation Field
items.description: Closure words. Talking about mindset. How to gain profit using your animation ability.

items.title: 22. Practice Making Illusion of 3D on Several Objects!
items.description: Rotation on fan. Rotation on lolipop. Rotation on drink can. Rotation on wind chimes.
